marketNews.title: US & China Reach Provisional Trade Deal
marketNews.content: The US and China on Monday (14/5) announced a temporary trade agreement, following the meeting between the two countries in Switzerland last weekend. This marks the first meeting between the US and China since the US announced reciprocal tariffs in April 2025. Under the agreement, the US and China each reduced import tariffs by 115% for at least 90 days. China will cut import tariffs on US products from 125% to 10%, while the US lowered tariffs on Chinese products from 145% to 30%. Although not covered in the joint statement of the meeting, the US and China also reportedly reduced trade barriers imposed by each party: Reuters reported that China will ease export restrictions to the US for rare earth and magnets commodities, which are generally used in high-tech industries. Bloomberg also reported that the Chinese government has cancelled the ban on Boeing aircraft deliveries. The US announced a reduction in the 'de minimis' tariff for China from 120% to 54%. The de minimis tariff itself is an import tariff for low-value goods (maximum 800 US dollars). However, Reuters sources reported that the reduction of the de minimis tariff currently follows the general import tariff reduction to 30%. This development in the de-escalation of the trade war has improved the outlook for the US economy. Goldman Sachs on Monday (12/5) cut the US recession projection from 45% to 35%, while also revising up the US 2025 economic growth projection from 0.5% to 1%. Optimism regarding the US economy was also driven by controlled consumer price index (CPI) inflation in April 2025 at the level of 2.3% YoY (vs. Mar 2025: 2.4% YoY inflation), lower than the consensus expectation of 2.4% YoY and marking the lowest annual level since February 2021. Along with the improving economic prospects from the trade war de-escalation, there is a consensus expectation that the pace of The Fed's interest rate cuts will slow down. Based on the CME FedWatch Tool, the probability of an interest rate cut of more than 50 bps until the end of 2025 was recorded at 35.9% as of Wednesday (14/5), a sharp drop from the level of 75.7% the previous week. Although a temporary agreement has been reached, US President Donald Trump said that import tariffs for China could still rise significantly if negotiations over the next 90 days fail to reach a final agreement. However, he emphasized that the US will not raise China tariffs back to the previous level of 145%. Following the US-China agreement, the US Dollar Index (DXY) strengthened by +1.09% to 101.79 on Monday (12/5). On the same day, the Nasdaq index rose +4.35%, followed by the S&P 500 (+3.26%) and DJIA (+2.81%). The strengthening of stock prices was also followed by Asian stock exchanges on Monday (12/5), with Nikkei +2.24% and Hang Seng +1.57%. Meanwhile, gold prices - which are a safe haven asset - fell -2.66% on Monday (12/5) to US$3,236.4/oz. Meanwhile, the IHSG rose +2.15% to 6,979.8 on Wednesday (14/5), driven by significant foreign inflow of 2.84 trillion rupiah. This marked the highest daily inflow since the announcement of reciprocal US tariffs.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although Indonesia itself has not yet reached a trade agreement with the US, better global economic growth prospects - following improvements in US and Chinese growth due to trade war de-escalation - can bring positive impacts to Indonesia. Additionally, decreasing external risk and risk-on sentiment potentially provide stability for the rupiah exchange rate. This can give room for Bank Indonesia to cut interest rates to help boost Indonesia's economic growth.

marketNews.title: Other hot topics you need to know about...
marketNews.content: MSCI announced evaluations for the Global Standard Index, Small Cap Index, and Micro Cap Index, effective for the period June 2, 2025-August 31, 2025. MTEL and MBMA enter the MSCI Indonesia Small Cap index, while HRUM, INDY, SMRA, and WIKA exit the index. Meanwhile, there are no changes in the MSCI Indonesia Global Standard index and the MSCI Indonesia Micro Cap index. The next evaluation will be announced on August 12, 2025, with the effective date of September 1, 2025. Gaikindo recorded that national car wholesales in April 2025 reached 51,205 units (+5% YoY, -28% MoM). This result made national car wholesales during 4M25 fall to 256,368 units (-3% YoY), although relatively in line with expectations as it equals 28-34% of Gaikindo's 2025 target in the range of 750,000-900,000 units (vs. 4M24: 30% of 2024 realization). The Chairman of Gaikindo, Jongkie Sugiarto, explained that the monthly decrease in car wholesales in April 2025 was triggered by fewer working days due to the long Eid al-Fitr 2025 holiday. Bank Indonesia estimates that Indonesian retail sales in April 2025 will contract by -2.2% YoY and -6.9% MoM due to demand normalization following the end of the Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr period. Meanwhile, the realization of retail sales in March 2025 grew +5.5% YoY and +13.6% MoM (vs. Feb 2025: +2% YoY, +3.3% MoM), exceeding Bank Indonesia's forecast of +0.5% YoY and +8.3% MoM. Commodity analysis firm, Kpler, noted that thermal coal exports from Indonesia dropped 20 million tons to 150 million tons during 4M25 (-12% YoY), marking the lowest export volume in the last 3 years and also the worst annual percentage decline since early 2017. The decline in Indonesian exports during 4M25 was suppressed by China and India who are currently boosting their domestic coal production. Exports to China decreased by 14 million tons or equivalent to -20% YoY during 4M25, while exports to India decreased by 6 million tons or equivalent to -15% YoY. Bloomberg reported that the Indonesian government is raising the CPO export levy from 7.5% to 10% effective May 17, 2025. This step is intended to fund the B40 program and replanting. Besides crude CPO, the government is also raising the levy for exports of other palm oil products, including crude palm olein from 6% to 9.5%, refined bleached and deodorized palm olein from 4.5% to 7.5%, and biodiesel from 3% to 4.75%. The US statistics bureau recorded that US CPI inflation in April 2025 reached 2.3% YoY and 0.2% MoM (vs. Mar 2025: 2.4% YoY inflation, -0.1% MoM deflation), respectively lower than the consensus expectation which predicted 2.4% YoY and 0.3% MoM inflation. This result marks the lowest annual CPI inflation since February 2021. Meanwhile, core inflation in April 2025 remained unchanged at 2.8% YoY (vs. Mar 2025: 2.8% YoY inflation), in line with consensus expectations while still being at the lowest level in the last 4 years. The Democratic Republic of Congo will impose tighter controls on cobalt exports when the export ban for this commodity ends, according to Patrick Luabeya, head of the strategic mineral control authority in that country. Previously, the Democratic Republic of Congo imposed a 4-month export ban starting in February 2025 to restore cobalt prices, a commodity used for electric vehicle batteries and mobile phones. In March 2025, the DRC government stated plans to implement cobalt export quotas and would partner with Indonesia to manage cobalt supply and prices in the global market. Shareholders of SINI, PT Autum Prima Indonesia, sold approximately 24.1 million SINI shares at a price of 1,000 rupiah per share on May 9, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 24 billion rupiah and was intended to increase the number of shares circulating among the public. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Autum Prima Indonesia in SINI decreased from 35% to 30%. Intanwijaya Internasional (INCI) will distribute a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of approximately 7.3 billion rupiah or 35 rupiah per share, equivalent to a 28% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 5.8% as of Wednesday (14/5). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is May 30, 2025, while payment is on July 17, 2025.

marketNews.title: Searching for SUM (Healthy Profitable Cheap) Stocks With Stockbit Screener
marketNews.content: Profit per share must be positive, meaning the company truly provides profit for shareholders. - Illusix

tickerNews.title: ASII: Car Wholesales -6% YoY in 4M25
tickerNews.content: ASII: Astra International recorded car wholesales of 26,976 units in April 2025 (+0% YoY, -29% MoM), lower compared to the industry realization (+5% YoY, -28% MoM), causing ASII's market share to drop to 52.7% (vs. Apr 2024: 55.2%, Mar 2025: 53.2%). ASII's car wholesales in April 2025 were supported by Toyota + Lexus sales of 16,268 units (+5% YoY, -28% MoM), while Daihatsu sales decreased to 8,884 units (-6% YoY, -32% MoM). Cumulatively, ASII's car wholesales for 4M25 decreased to 137,788 units (-6% YoY), with the market share falling to 53.7% (vs. 4M24: 55.5%).

tickerNews.title: ENRG: Announcement of Oil Discovery in Bentu Block, Riau
tickerNews.content: ENRG: Energi Mega Persada announced that the company found oil reserves in the Bentu work area, Riau, with an initial estimate of 20 million barrels. This finding potentially adds production of approximately 1,500-2,500 barrels of oil per day, equivalent to 17.6-29.5% of ENRG's oil production (gross) in 1Q25 at 8,479 barrels per day. The Bentu work area primarily produces gas, with contingent reserves and resources of 375.6 billion cubic feet of gas as of January 1, 2025. This asset is also targeted to produce 93 million cubic feet of gas per day throughout 2025. The Bentu work area is operated and 100% controlled by the company's subsidiary, EMP Bentu Limited.

tickerNews.title: GOTO plans share buyback with up to USD 200 million allocation
tickerNews.content: GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia plans to conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 200 million US dollars or 3.3 trillion rupiah from June 19, 2025, to June 18, 2026, although the company did not specify the maximum number of shares to be purchased. This plan will be discussed at the General Meeting of Shareholders (GMS) on June 18, 2025. This plan is a corporate action separate from the existing buyback, where as of April 2025, GOTO had realized a buyback value of 112.3 million US dollars or ~1.8 trillion rupiah out of a maximum total fund allocation of 200 million US dollars. The existing buyback will end in June 2025.

tickerNews.title: PTPP: New Contract Value in 1Q25 Reaches ~IDR 6.3 Trillion
tickerNews.content: PTPP: PT PP recorded that the new contract value during 1Q25 reached ~6.3 trillion rupiah (+32% YoY), equivalent to ~22% of the 2025 target of 28.5 trillion rupiah. According to its sources, the contract value originated from State-Owned Enterprise projects contributing 52%, followed by private sector (29%) and government (19%).

tickerNews.title: AMMN Applies for Extension of Concentrator Export Permit Due to Smelter Commissioning Delays
tickerNews.content: AMMN: The President Director of Amman Mineral Internasional, Alexander Ramlie, stated that the company has officially applied for an extension of the copper cathode and concentrate export permit to the government. This step was taken as the commissioning process for the company's smelter is proceeding slowly due to stabilization and refinement periods, resulting in non-maximal operating capacity. AMMN's copper concentrate export had ended on December 31, 2024.

tickerNews.title: BFIN to Distribute 2024 FY Dividend of ~IDR 902.4 Billion
tickerNews.content: BFIN: BFI Finance Indonesia will distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to ~902.4 billion rupiah or equivalent to a 58% dividend payout ratio, indicating a final dividend of 32 rupiah per share and a final dividend yield of 3.5% as of Wednesday (14/5). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is May 20, 2025, while payment is on June 11, 2025. Previously, BFIN had distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 28 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: LTLS to Distribute 2024 FY Dividend of IDR 65.9 Billion
tickerNews.content: LTLS: Lautan Luas plans to distribute a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 65.9 billion rupiah or 45 rupiah per share, equivalent to a 30% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 4.7% as of Wednesday (14/5). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is May 19, 2025, while payment is on June 5, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Tolaram Pte. Ltd. Increases AMAR Ownership to 75.25% After Buying 790 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: AMAR: The controller of Bank Amar Indonesia, Tolaram Pte. Ltd., purchased 790 million AMAR shares at a price of 171 rupiah per share on May 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 135 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of Tolaram Pte. Ltd. in AMAR increased from 70.95% to 75.25%.
